texts: for those who owndrive a vehicle what do you drive i dont have a lot of knowledge with cars but i will likely need a different vehicle in 13 years i also am itching to go electric but i believe the federal tax credit is getting wiped if i remember correctly just want to know what everyone is using as wheels these days just figured its a nice change of conversation on here

moveset concept asami for the fighting game not entirely sure what the controls are at the moment so im just gonna wing it this moveset can be adapted to whatever the controls turn out to be asami 5l she does a quick palmstrike forward with her electric glove 2l she does a knee strike forward 5m she does a clawstrike downward with her electric glove 2m she does an upward swinging crescent kick 5h she does a powerful steppingforward palmstrike forward with her electric glove 2h she crouches to the ground and spins into a big upward hook kick air invincible j5l she holds her electric glove down to shock the opponent j5m she only does two aerial moves in the series make something up j5h she does a scissorleg grab on the opponent then flips midair and throws them to the side air grab 236l she grabs the opponents arm with her electric glove hand and that arms shoulder with her other hand pushes them into an armlock and shocks them with her electric glove on their other shoulder command grab 236m she parries with one hand and does a spinning backhand palmstrike with her electric glove physical counter 236h she takes a strong stance and blocks with one arm while doing a palmstrike forward with her electric glove super armor 214l she ducks and does a swinging hook palmstrike with her electric glove mid invincible 214m she does a backflip forward if she flips over an opponents head she will land and grab their back with her electric glove shocking them crossup super she drives a car with mako and bolin inside a transformation that changes her moveset does damage if she drives into the opponent input again to get out l she drifts the car hitting the opponent with the rear as it spins m mako shoots lighting forward h bolin creates a ramp in front of the car that allow it to jump while falling it can hit the opponent air super she flies a plane with mako and bolin on the wings a transformation that changes her moveset does damage if she flies into the opponent input again to get out l she does a loop that can hit the opponent and dodge attacks m mako shoots fire blasts downward h bolin flings rocks that have bombs attached to them downward input again to make them explode ultimate she pilots a mecha a transformation that changes her moveset input again to get out l she swings the mechas arm down smashing whatever is in front of it 6l she fires an electric bolo forward tying up the opponent hitgrab m she grabs the opponents arm and swings to throw them far away command grab 6m she shoots two grappling hooks forward from both arms they grab whatever they hit and pull it in towards her hitgrab h she grabs the opponents chest with both mecha arms and pulls apart to rip them in half command grab cinematic finisher i really like the idea of giving her vehicles for her supers it feels authentic to the various vehicle battleschases in legend of korra and asami was usually the driver for those

the ultimate 48v go kart buyers guide power speed safety explained so your young racer has outgrown their 24v toy go kart the thrill is fading and theyre hungry for more speed more power and more of a real driving experience welcome to the big leagues the 48v go kart this isnt just a small step up its a gamechanger a 48v system provides the perfect sweet spot between a beginners kart and a highperformance gaspowered monster it offers serious speed and excitement without the complexity noise and maintenance of an engine click here to check the product on amazon if youre considering a 48v go kart youve got questions how fast are they are they safe who are they really for this guide will answer everything you need to know before you buy click here to check the product on amazon what exactly does 48v mean and why you should care think of voltage like water pressure in a hose click here to check the product on amazon a 12v or 24v kart is like a garden hose its fun for little kids but the power is limited a 48v kart is like a pressure washer it delivers a powerful consistent blast of energy to the motor that higher pressure directly translates to more available power for the motor which means faster acceleration and a higher top speed its the key to unlocking a much more thrilling ride that feels responsive and capable on varied terrain click here to check the product on amazon voltage level typical top speed best for 24v 812 mph young kids ages 58 36v 1217 mph preteens ages 812 48v 1525 mph teens hobbyists ages 9 click here to check the product on amazon the need for speed how fast can a 48v go kart really go lets get right to it this is the question on every riders mind click here to check the product on amazon a typical 48v go kart can reach speeds between 15 and 25 mph 2440 kmh thats a significant jump from its lowervoltage cousins for context 25 mph feels incredibly fast when youre just a few inches off the ground its fast enough to be exhilarating but usually not so fast that it becomes unmanageable for a responsible young rider click here to check the product on amazon factors that influence the actual speed motor wattage a 48v kart with a 1000w motor will be noticeably faster and more powerful than one with a 500w motor riders weight a lighter rider will reach higher top speeds and accelerate faster terrain youll go fastest on smooth flat pavement hills grass and dirt will naturally slow the kart down tire pressure properly inflated tires make a big difference in rolling resistance and speed click here to check the product on amazon who is a 48v go kart for finding the perfect rider click here to check the product on amazon a 48v go kart isnt a onesizefitsall machine its best suited for a specific type of rider the young racer ages 813 click here to check the product on amazon this is the perfect age to graduate to 48v theyve developed the coordination and judgment needed to handle the extra speed look for models with parental controls a key or remote that allows you to limit the max speed adjustable seats so the kart can grow with your child robust safety features well cover these in detail below the teenage thrillseeker ages 13 click here to check the product on amazon for a teenager a 48v kart is an absolute blast it provides the speed and independence they crave while keeping them away from the dangers of public roads its a fantastic way to learn basic driving dynamics like steering braking and weight transfer in a controlled environment the adult hobbyist click here to check the product on amazon who says kids get to have all the fun many 48v karts have a high weight capacity 200 lbs and durable steel frames making them a great option for adults who want to tear around a private track or large property theyre quiet relatively lowmaintenance and a ton of fun click here to check the product on amazon key features to look for in a quality 48v go kart youre ready to buy awesome but dont just click the first shiny listing you see heres your checklist for a smart purchase click here to check the product on amazon motor power watts dont just look at the voltage aim for at least a 1000w motor for a genuinely exciting experience 500w is entrylevel for this class battery life quality most 48v karts will run for 3060 minutes of continuous hard use battery type most come with sealed leadacid sla batteries theyre heavy and have a shorter lifespan if you can find one with a lithiumion battery jump on itits lighter charges faster and lasts much longer charge time expect a 68 hour charge time look for karts with a smart charger to prevent overcharging safety first this is nonnegotiable hydraulic disc brakes these are far superior to flimsy drum or band brakes they provide reliable powerful stopping power roll cage a full steel roll cage is essential for protecting the driver in case of a tipover safety harnessseatbelt a 4point or 5point harness is much better than a simple lap belt safety flag a tall brightly colored flag makes the kart visible over tall grass and small hills durability build quality frame a hightensile steel frame is a must avoid flimsy plastic or thinwalled steel tubing suspension for serious fun on bumpy terrain look for independent suspension on the front wheels tires airfilled pneumatic tires provide a much better grip and ride than solid plastic ones click here to check the product on amazon maintenance 101 keeping your kart running smoothly an electric go kart is far easier to maintain than a gas one but its not maintenancefree follow these simple steps for years of fun click here to check the product on amazon 1 charge after every use dont let the battery sit completely discharged 2 inspect inflate check tire pressure before each ride 3 clean it wipe off mud and grime after each use to prevent corrosion 4 tighten up periodically check all bolts and nuts especially on the wheels and roll cage click here to check the product on amazon final verdict is a 48v go kart worth it absolutely click here to check the product on amazon for anyone looking to take their gokarting experience from toy to thrill ride a 48v model is the perfect choice it delivers an incredible amount of fun a genuine sense of speed and a fantastic introduction to the principles of vehicle dynamics by focusing on safety features build quality and motor power you can find a 48v go kart that is not only an amazing gift but also a safe and durable machine that will be cherished for years click here to check the product on amazon ready to hit the track what features are most important to you when looking for a 48v go kart let me know in the comments below

coal exports have declined more than 10 so far in 2025 in the worlds top coalexporting nations as chinese renewables replace global demand the chinese renewables juggernaut rolls on today its coal soon it will be the same story for oil australia is offering consumers three hours of free solar power a day to help stabilise its grid and use up excess power that is going to waste in offpeak periods those 3 hours will be enough to fully charge many peoples electric vehicles gascombustion engine cars are already in their horse buggy phase some people just havent caught up to reality yet australian thermal coal producers are losing their growth markets us coal exports drop 11 indonesias coal exports dropped 12

advice on buying a used car from donedeal found a used fiat panda on donedeal bought a history report for the vehicle seems fine except motor tax just ran out its had 6 previous owners over 12 years 190 km on the odometer its a 12l engine car so far the only things i can ask the seller is service history milage look at engine and underneath for any rust clutch break pads electrics and engine incase theres any damage not sure if theres anything else or anything more i need to be doing if anyone has any advice let me know

speculating on teslas 1015 year plan and the phase out of s3xy plaidperformance cars it looks like tesla is inevitably moving away from producing consumer cars to producing purposebuilt autonomous vehicles as evidenced by the production of the cybercab possibly the robovan and the plans for optimus what do we all think of this i personally became a huge tesla fan because they get a lot of things right when making cars they get their designs right all of their cars look beautiful s3xy their performance well all of their cars are speeddemons model 3 handles well around a track their simplicity their software their spec choice i do like not having to choose between 10000000 different options however with all of the things they get right it looks like they just want to move on which is super sad i will always love how good the model s plaid is and the model 3 performance is as technological showcases for their halo products however i do find it sad that the model s plaid has not actually received a proper update in so long yes many ppl can attribute this to poor sales however its like the chicken or the egg problem maybe they would increase sales if they added a new 800v platform but i am worried that their other two well selling cars will eventually fall in this hole too of becoming a zombie product if teslas optimus and cybercab do well enough i really want tesla to remain competitive within the premium performance electric vehicle space the model 3 performance is pretty much peak ev and i do hope to see tesla continue this lead well into the future what are your thoughts

zero down payment 100 onroad finance 8year battery loan jsw mg motor india in collaboration with axis bank has introduced an innovative dual loan program designed to make electric mobility more accessible and futureready for indian customers anchored in mgs pioneering batteryasaservice baas model this initiative allows customers to avail separate loans for the vehicle and its battery significantly reducing the upfront cost of ownership the program offers up to 100 onroad funding and flexible tenures of up to 8 years for the battery turning conventional fuel expenses into predictable longterm value and making sustainable driving a practical intelligent choice

type a rcbo vs type b rcd good evening all odd one here looking to have 40a circuit installed at home for an ip66 32a switched socket outlet outside primarily this would mostly be used for future ev charging just into the switched socket outlet 32a single phase extension lead from switched socket outlet going into the car there wont be a dedicated ac ev charger being installed as the cars can handle their own charging through their onboard inverters and they have the ability to run timers on when they start charging looks like theres no type b rcbo theres only an rcd which means its going to take up a bit of space in the board vs just using a 40a type a rcbo and be done with it would be using mode 2 charging method appendix p p153 p153 mode 2 charging connection of the ev to the ac supply network mains utilizing standardized singlephase or threephase socketoutlets not exceeding 32 a and not exceeding 250 v ac singlephase or 480 v ac threephase at the supply side and utilizing the live and protective earth conductors together with a control pilot function and system of personnel protection against electric shock rcd between the ev and the plug or as part of the incable control box p4 devices for protection against indirect contact by automatic disconnection of supply p41 rcds each connecting point should be protected by its own rcd of at least type a having a rated residual operating current not exceeding 30 ma where the ev charging station is equipped with a socketoutlet or vehicle connector complying with the iec 62196 series protective measures against dc fault current should be taken except where provided by the ev charging station the following measures apply for each connection point a rcd type b b rcd type a and appropriate equipment that ensures disconnection of the supply in case of dc fault current above 6 ma the requirements of asnzs 3190 asnzs 61008 asnzs 61009 asnzs 60947 series or iec 62423 apply to rcds rcds should disconnect all live conductors p41b is that referring to the type a rcbo itself needing to trip on dc fault current above 6ma or is this referring to another device that has to be connected with the socket outlet the spec sheets on the rcbos dont mention anything about their ratings for dc fault currents unless im reading them incorrectly 40a type a rcbo type b rccb big difference in price there would you just yolo and 40a type a rcbo and be done with it or lose a lot of space in the board going the type b rccb 40a mcb thanks all

hinting strongly at a rate cut possibly in december governor andrew bailey is shifting his stance while inflation eases the market is already pricing in a 55 chance of a cut on december 18 bad timing warner bros discovery nasdaq wbd just released a dumpsterfire of an earnings report they added only 23 million streaming subscribers far below expectations and their cable business is continuing its freefall not even a magic spell will fix this one whats happening today earnings from constellation energy ceg and kkr co kkr low impact anticipated motor that was unexpected in short the uk is gearing up to create a tax on electric vehicles evs similar to othersbut just when ev demand is booming the uk government plans to impose a 3 pence per mile charge for ev drivers starting in 2028 according to the financial times that translates into 250 extra per year for the average ev driver still less than the 600 paid by a typical gasoline vehicle driver the aim to plug the 30 billion hole in fueltax revenue industry reactions volvo cars called it penalizing positive development and polestar called it a farce given ev sales are up 30 this year and 1 in every 4 new cars is electric the timing is questionable why you care in iceland and new zealand similar taxes sent ev sales tumbling dont assume the us or other markets are immune either macro close to home in short the us and 1111 patton street magnolia ar 71753 nice lot in the lithium boomtown of magnolia arkansas priced way below area comparable sales in the area debitcredit cards accepted no closing costs cash price 1650 finance with 200 down and 18 payments of 100 per month no credit check no income documentation no prepayment penalty property address 1111 patton street magnolia ar 71753 map location is approximate county columbia assessor parcel number 010345600000 legal description lot 14 block 16 stevensdale zoning residential annual property taxes 2715 magnolia arkansas preparing for lithium boom several companies are expanding in south arkansas some are even looking at the possibly of lithium production an essential in electric vehicle batteries one concern are there enough homes in the city to handle the growth the demand for lithium is only going to increase america needs more lithium production so were not reliant on enemy countries like china that produces so much of the worlds lithium and other rare earth elements we need housing we have the infrastructure were extending infrastructure but we need housing said magnolia mayor parnell vann all that housing is needed because exxonmobil is planning to build one of the worlds largest lithium processing facilities near town other companies such as tetra and standard lithium have also acquired thousands of acres in brine leases in columbia and lafayette counties the southwest region is located on a geological formation brimming with saltwater brine the companies plan to chemically extract lithium from the brine city leaders believe lithium extraction facilities could bring up to 6000 jobs to magnolia with southwest arkansas primed to be a leader in lithium production business leaders in magnolia say they want to be prepared to take advantage of this growing industry even though housing is tough to find right now he believes if they can get the right investors more people in town will benefit the entire community even without the recent talk of lithium production vann says two existing companies in other industries have already made plans for expansion the potlatchdeltic timber corporation is investing 130 million in upgrades and the albemarle corporation a specialty chemical manufacturer is investing 540 million which means hundreds of new jobs state leaders have said south arkansas potentially has enough lithium to produce about 15 of the worlds lithium magnolia a bluecollar town in the states southern region was once a locus for oil but is on track to become a major producer of lithium dubbed white gold because of its soft silverywhite look and the fact it powers most modern tech from cellphones to laptops and electric cars exxon mobil is planning to build one of the worlds largest lithium processing facilities near the town with a capacity to produce 75000 to 100000 metric tons of lithium a year sources say which would be 15 percent of the worlds lithium production the town is located on what is known as the smackover formation a geological formation that runs from texas to florida and is brimming with saltwater brine which contains small amounts of lithium lithium is going to be huge in magnolia it is not so much as the lithium but the jobs that will go with it he added that everything from truck stops to auto body shops and clothing stores in and around the small town will see growth exxon mobil purchased 120000 gross acres in may and is developing more than 6100 lithiumrich acres in arkansas with tetra technologies exxon mobil predicts it could produce up to 110000 tons of lithium annually enough to power 50 million electric vehicles tetra which produces chemicals for water treatment and recycling in june said it had signed an agreement with a company known as saltwerx to develop 6138 acres of salty brine deposits in arkansas that are filled with lithium and bromine although it provided few additional details saltwerx is a subsidiary of exxon according to two people familiar with the matter also moving into the southern state is vancouverbased standard lithium which secured rights for 30000 acres of brine leases west of magnolia standard lithium announced in may that it sampled arkansass highest confirmed lithiumgrade brine additional information

the rising market of china used cars a new era for smart buyers in recent years chinas used car market has experienced an impressive surge transforming from a small segment of the automotive industry into a major economic force once overshadowed by the booming new car market the used car sector in china is now gaining recognition as an essential component of the nations mobility landscape driven by economic changes improved regulations and shifting consumer preferences used cars have become a practical and desirable option for millions of chinese drivers this evolution represents not only an economic trend but also a reflection of how modern chinese consumers value affordability sustainability and technology in their transportation choices 1 the rapid growth of chinas used car market over the past decade chinas used car industry has grown exponentially fueled by a maturing economy and a massive increase in private vehicle ownership as china became the worlds largest car market millions of new cars entered circulation every yearcreating a robust supply of highquality used vehicles in 2024 alone chinas used car transactions exceeded 20 million units a figure that continues to rise annually several factors have contributed to this expansion government initiatives aimed at promoting vehicle circulation improved online marketplaces and the introduction of transparent pricing systems have all made it easier and safer to buy preowned vehicles additionally the rising cost of new carsespecially with luxury and electric vehicle brandshas encouraged consumers to explore more economical alternatives this combination of affordability and convenience has established used cars as a vital segment of chinas automotive future for more china used cars 2 shifting consumer attitudes and market confidence a decade ago chinese consumers were generally hesitant to purchase used cars due to concerns about quality reliability and lack of transparency however that perception has changed dramatically todays buyers are more informed techsavvy and pragmatic they recognize that a used car can deliver exceptional value without sacrificing performance or prestige the growing trust in certified preowned cpo programs and reputable dealers has also played a crucial role in reshaping public opinion platforms such as guazi uxin and renrenche have revolutionized the market by offering transparent vehicle histories fair pricing systems and professional inspections these online platforms allow buyers to compare models check accident reports and even arrange financingall from their smartphones the use of technology and data has brought muchneeded credibility to the used car market helping it shed its old image of being disorganized or risky as a result more middleclass and younger buyers are turning to preowned cars as smart modern investments 3 economic and environmental advantages of used cars in china the financial benefits of purchasing a used car are among the most compelling reasons for its popularity with new vehicles depreciating up to 30 in their first year buying a used car allows chinese consumers to avoid rapid value loss while enjoying the same functionality moreover lower purchase taxes insurance premiums and registration fees make used cars particularly attractive for budgetconscious families and firsttime buyers beyond the economic appeal the environmental impact of extending vehicle lifecycles is significant the production of new vehicles demands vast amounts of energy and raw materials contributing to pollution and carbon emissions by purchasing used cars chinese consumers help reduce waste and promote sustainable consumption this aligns with chinas broader goals of achieving carbon neutrality and encouraging a circular economy many local governments are now supporting vehicle recycling programs and promoting secondhand car transactions as part of their green initiatives 4 technology electrification and export opportunities one of the most exciting developments in chinas used car market is the growing presence of electric and hybrid vehicles as china leads the global shift toward new energy vehicles nevs a large number of firstgeneration electric cars are now entering the secondhand market these vehicles often wellmaintained and relatively new provide an affordable entry point for ecoconscious buyers who want to transition to cleaner energy in addition to domestic sales chinas used car exports are on the rise the chinese government has introduced policies encouraging the export of used vehicles to markets in africa southeast asia and eastern europe these regions benefit from affordable reliable cars while china gains new economic opportunities and reduces waste domestically the export of used cars has also boosted the demand for quality inspections logistics and aftersales servicescreating thousands of new jobs and business prospects technological advancements are further accelerating market development artificial intelligence big data and blockchain are being used to verify vehicle history predict pricing trends and ensure authenticity in transactions this digital transformation has made buying and selling used cars faster safer and more efficient than ever before 5 challenges and the road ahead for chinas used car industry despite the rapid growth the chinese used car market still faces challenges regional restrictions on vehicle transfers inconsistent regulations and uneven inspection standards can complicate transactions between provinces additionally older vehicles that do not meet environmental standards are being phased out requiring better recycling systems and consumer education however ongoing reforms are addressing these issues the chinese government is working to unify registration systems simplify vehicle transfer procedures and establish national inspection standards more automakers are launching their own certified preowned divisions to ensure quality and build consumer trust as infrastructure improves rural and smaller city markets are expected to become major growth areas for used car sales looking ahead the future of chinas used car industry appears exceptionally bright the market is expected to surpass new car sales in volume within the next decade supported by strong demand digital innovation and policy support as chinese consumers continue to embrace the value and practicality of preowned vehicles used cars will play a central role in shaping a more efficient affordable and sustainable transportation system conclusion the transformation of chinas used car market marks a significant milestone in the nations automotive journey what was once viewed with skepticism has now become a thriving techdriven industry that combines affordability sustainability and innovation with increased consumer confidence government backing and advanced digital platforms buying a used car in china is now a smart and forwardthinking decision as the market continues to expand domestically and globally china is poised to lead the next chapter in the global used car revolutiondriving both economic growth and environmental progress for years to come

whats the actual battery degradation on evs a largescale swedish study by kvdbil reveals that 8 in 10 used electric vehicles retain over 90 battery health challenging the myth of rapid ev battery degradation according to another study on average cars retained 90 of their battery capacity after 145000 km thats already impressive but keep in mind that battery degradation is most significant within the first couple of years a car with around 210000 km on it still retained 85 of its original battery capacity there are even plenty of examples of cars surpassing 320000 or even 480000 km with 80 capacity or more

whatever happened to solar roadways a decade later heres why the viral 4m project failed and what we learned remember the solar freakin roadways video from 2014 it got 22 million views and raised over 4 million with promises of highways that generate power melt snow and display led traffic patterns a decade later every major installation has failed heres the reality check the major installations frances wattway 2016 cost 52 million for 06 miles promise 300000 kwh annually reality only 80000 kwh 73 below target status closed in 2019 after rapid deterioration chinas solar highway 2017 opened in jinan panels stolen within 5 days no performance data ever released current status unknown usa idaho demo 2016 150 sq ft sidewalk cost 60000 39240 per kw caught fire shortly after installation leds barely visible in daylight failed to melt snow still having ongoing issues why solar roadways dont work physics problems flat mounting 3040 efficiency loss vs angled panels vehicle shadows cut efficiency by 50 road debris and dirt block sunlight embedded panels overheat no air circulation cant balance durability transparency economic reality solar roadways 1500030000 per kw utility solar 10001500 per kw rooftop solar 25004000 per kw thats 1020x more expensive for significantly worse performance the led problem nobody talks about the led lighting system in solar roadways design would consume over 25 of the electricity the panels generate so even if everything worked perfectly youd lose a quarter of your power just lighting the road what actually works conventional solar installations alongside roads solar canopies roadside solar farms generate vastly more power at a fraction of the cost highway rightofway often has plenty of unused land perfect for standard solar arrays the lesson this isnt about discouraging innovation its about physics and economics sometimes the boring solution regular solar panels on rooftops and solar farms is actually the revolutionary one because it works and scales the solar roadways concept captured imaginations but couldnt overcome fundamental engineering reality meanwhile conventional solar costs have dropped 80 in the past decade and continue improving

to 2month period during which physical pollution sources are paused or filtered while essential work continues remotely this pause allows natural atmospheric recovery and gives time to install clean systems before normal operations resume main pillars of the plan 1 workfromhome and digital transition all offices schools and institutions that can operate remotely switch to wfh or online mode reduces daily road traffic by up to 70 based on 2020 lockdown data this can cut delhis pm25 concentration by more than half within a week 2 electric and cngonly transport only electric or cng vehicles operate during the reset period ban on diesel and older petrol vehicles public ev buses and erickshaws continue for essential movement rapid ev charging hubs set up in major zones 3 controlled industrial operation nonessential industries pause completely for the reset duration essential industries operate inside enclosed containment structures with emission filters or scrubbers pollutants are captured filtered and safely stored or recycled instead of being released into open air 4 pollution capture and recycling captured carbon and particulate matter are converted into usable products such as building blocks road mix or fuel components encourages a circulareconomy approach pollution becomes raw material government provides incentives for companies adopting carboncapture and reuse systems 5 construction and burning ban all construction demolition garbage burning and cropresidue burning are suspended during the reset use of antismog guns and regular water sprinkling on major energy efficiency creation of green jobs in ev airfiltration and recycling sectors summary instead of continuously fighting rising pollution while daily emissions continue this plan enforces a short strategic pause that allows nature to recover and industries to reform the green reset city plan is realistic economically manageable and achievable using todays technologies remote work electric mobility emission filtration and circular recycling making it a practical model for any heavily polluted city

deck in front of the superstructure we find the satcom antenna ensuring communications via the low earth orbit satellite constellation for remote control at distance even over the horizon followed by the electro opticinfrared suite three lidar ensuring obstacle avoidance capacity the bow hosts a remotely controlled weapon station armed with a 127 mm heavy machine gun the boat has a displacement of more than meets the road the critical role of pcba in automotive electronics evolution the automotive industry is undergoing a seismic shift from mechanical marvels to softwaredefined computers on wheels at the heart of this transformation lies the printed circuit board assembly pcba which has evolved from controlling basic functions to becoming the central nervous system of the modern vehicle this article delves into the unique demands and future trends of automotive pcba where failure is not an option the unforgiving environment reliability under extreme conditions automotive pcbas are not built for a controlled lab environment they must operate flawlessly for over a decade while exposed to extreme temperatures from 40c in winter to over 125c under the hood vibration and shock constant mechanical stress from road conditions humidity and contaminants resistance to moisture salt and chemicals this necessitates the use of robust materials like hightg glass transition temperature laminates conformal coating for protection and stringent reliability testing far beyond commercial standards the shift to 48volt systems and highpower applications in electric vehicles evs further escalates the requirements for superior thermal management and highcurrent carrying capacity the safety imperative from adas to functional safety as vehicles gain autonomy through advanced driverassistance systems adas the pcbas role becomes safetycritical a malfunction in a radar or lidar sensor pcba can have catastrophic consequences this demands adherence to strict functional safety standards like iso 26262 asil levels which governs the entire product lifecycle pcba designs must incorporate redundancy fault diagnostics and use components with proven automotivegrade pedigrees every solder joint trace and component is part of a complex safety equation the future zonal architectures and hdi the traditional architecture of individual electronic control units ecus for each function is giving way to centralized highperformance computers connected via zonal gateways this paradigm shift demands a new class of pcbas highdensity interconnect hdi to accommodate the high pincount processors and finerpitch components required for powerful domain controllers highspeed design managing signal integrity for multigigabit ethernet can fd and other highspeed data links that form the vehicles data backbone advanced materials leveraging substrates with optimized dielectric properties for highfrequency rf applications eg 5gv2x mmwave radar conclusion in the automotive sector the pcba is a key enabler of innovation safety and reliability success hinges on partnering with a pcba manufacturer that possesses deep expertise in automotivegrade materials processes and the rigorous quality management systems required to navigate this complex landscape the road to the future of driving is literally paved with advanced circuit boards if you wish to learn more about pcba we warmly invite you to contact our inhouse engineers at kingshengpcba or visit our official website we look forward to your inquiry

cement power data the pulse of indias growth how sector trends reveal economic momentum and smart investment opportunities using sectoral data to predict economic trends an economists framework for investors when assessing the economic health of a nation economists rely on a set of highfrequency sectoral indicatorsespecially in sectors like cement power steel and infrastructure these sectors act as leading indicators helping predict future economic momentum well before official gdp numbers or policy steps confirm the trend lets break down how sectorspecific data matters and how it might influence investment or trading decisions 1 cement production consumption why it matters the cement sector is perhaps the most powerful economic pulsecheck for a developing country cement is the foundation of construction and infrastructuretwo of the biggest job and growth multipliers in an economy signals rising cement dispatches consumption higher construction and infrastructure activity boost in jobs and commodity demand early sign of strong economic expansion falling cement demand weakness in real estate or infra investment can signal economic slowdown or policy tightening investor angle high cement growth often aligns with improving corporate capex and government spending regional cement demand can reveal where the construction cycle is strongest eg central india vs western india cement utilization and capacity additions also reflect future confidence 2 power generation consumption why it matters electricity usage reflects overall economic productivity and living standards whether its households businesses factories or evseverything runs on power signals rising power consumption industrial recovery and lifestyle upgrades eg rural electrification higher utilization of industrial plants flat or declining power use industrial slowdown energy efficiency gains or shift to renewables without proportional demand surge can reflect demand fatigue or economic cooling investor angle growing power demand benefits utilities renewables transmission companies demandsupply gap shrinking signals potential plateauinvestors may look for quality over volume growth 3 steel capital goods why they matter steel and capital goods are deeply linked with infrastructure automobile and manufacturing sectors they indicate investment and production strength signals higher steel dispatches more construction auto production capital goods order books strong business confidence factory expansions investor angle steel uptrend buy cyclical stocks related to manufacturing mining infra coordinated strength in cement steel power confirmed industrial upswing 4 sector crossvalidation economists dont view data in isolation they overlay data across sectors to detect real turning points indicatorwhat it shows cement power steelcore economy health infra real estate industry bank credit growthfinancial confidence liquidity gst collectionsdemand strength and business activity rail freightgoods movement and supply chain flow vehicle salesconsumer and business sentiment pmi manufacturingservicesexpansion or contraction cycle crosschecking avoids false signalseg cement may spike because of pricing but rail freight and power may still be weak 5 leading vs lagging indicators understanding timing is crucial leading indicators ahead of cyclelagging indicators confirm the cycle cement dispatch power demandemployment bank npas cpi inflation steel production capital goodscorporate profits tax revenues smart investors and macro traders rely on leading indicators to get ahead of the crowd 6 what this means for forecasting economistsand now serious investorsuse these signals to determine whether were in an expansion slowdown or late cycle estimate potential gdp growth range and corporate earnings prospects predict policy actions like rate hikes stimulus or capex push adjust portfolio allocation between cyclical and defensive stocks 7 limitations to watch just like price action can give fake breakouts economic data too can mislead strong cement demand could reflect preelection government spending surge a rise in power demand might be due to summer heatwave not industry policydriven credit booms could inflate steel or cement temporarily inventories may distort real consumption signals so always filter data for real sustainable demand not shortlived boosts

cement power data the pulse of indias growth how sector trends reveal economic momentum and smart investment opportunities using sectoral data to predict economic trends an economists framework for investors when assessing the economic health of a nation economists rely on a set of highfrequency sectoral indicatorsespecially in sectors like cement power steel and infrastructure these sectors act as leading indicators helping predict future economic momentum well before official gdp numbers or policy steps confirm the trend lets break down how sectorspecific data matters and how it might influence investment or trading decisions 1 cement production consumption why it matters the cement sector is perhaps the most powerful economic pulsecheck for a developing country cement is the foundation of construction and infrastructuretwo of the biggest job and growth multipliers in an economy signals rising cement dispatches consumption higher construction and infrastructure activity boost in jobs and commodity demand early sign of strong economic expansion falling cement demand weakness in real estate or infra investment can signal economic slowdown or policy tightening investor angle high cement growth often aligns with improving corporate capex and government spending regional cement demand can reveal where the construction cycle is strongest eg central india vs western india cement utilization and capacity additions also reflect future confidence 2 power generation consumption why it matters electricity usage reflects overall economic productivity and living standards whether its households businesses factories or evseverything runs on power signals rising power consumption industrial recovery and lifestyle upgrades eg rural electrification higher utilization of industrial plants flat or declining power use industrial slowdown energy efficiency gains or shift to renewables without proportional demand surge can reflect demand fatigue or economic cooling investor angle growing power demand benefits utilities renewables transmission companies demandsupply gap shrinking signals potential plateauinvestors may look for quality over volume growth 3 steel capital goods why they matter steel and capital goods are deeply linked with infrastructure automobile and manufacturing sectors they indicate investment and production strength signals higher steel dispatches more construction auto production capital goods order books strong business confidence factory expansions investor angle steel uptrend buy cyclical stocks related to manufacturing mining infra coordinated strength in cement steel power confirmed industrial upswing 4 sector crossvalidation economists dont view data in isolation they overlay data across sectors to detect real turning points indicatorwhat it shows cement power steelcore economy health infra real estate industry bank credit growthfinancial confidence liquidity gst collectionsdemand strength and business activity rail freightgoods movement and supply chain flow vehicle salesconsumer and business sentiment pmi manufacturingservicesexpansion or contraction cycle crosschecking avoids false signalseg cement may spike because of pricing but rail freight and power may still be weak 5 leading vs lagging indicators understanding timing is crucial leading indicators ahead of cyclelagging indicators confirm the cycle cement dispatch power demandemployment bank npas cpi inflation steel production capital goodscorporate profits tax revenues smart investors and macro traders rely on leading indicators to get ahead of the crowd 6 what this means for forecasting economistsand now serious investorsuse these signals to determine whether were in an expansion slowdown or late cycle estimate potential gdp growth range and corporate earnings prospects predict policy actions like rate hikes stimulus or capex push adjust portfolio allocation between cyclical and defensive stocks 7 limitations to watch just like price action can give fake breakouts economic data too can mislead strong cement demand could reflect preelection government spending surge a rise in power demand might be due to summer heatwave not industry policydriven credit booms could inflate steel or cement temporarily inventories may distort real consumption signals so always filter data for real sustainable demand not shortlived boosts

solidstate batteries power the future chinese ev maker turns to humanoid robots a chinese electric vehicle company has announced plans to use solidstate batteries to power its upcoming humanoid robots by 2026 the idea is that solidstate batteries could make robots lighter safer and more energyefficient while also accelerating development of this nextgen battery tech unlike conventional lithiumion batteries solidstate versions use a solid electrolyte instead of a flammable liquid improving energy density and reducing fire risks the company says its already working with suppliers and expects its first large batch of robots to roll out by late 2026 these robots could be used in factories customer service and other roles that benefit from advanced mobility and safety experts say solidstate batteries may first find practical use in robots and small aircraft before being adopted at scale in electric vehicles due to the higher safety demands and smaller production volumes whats your take could robots become the first realworld testbed for solidstate battery technology before evs catch up

authorized dealers by 2027 can expand horizontally into charging stations fleet leasing or accessories food franchises require strong operational teams and inventory consistency expansion limited by location saturation one kfc every few kilometers scaling requires multiunit management and higher rentals ev franchises scale wider faster and cheaper risk and regulation check every business carries risks some manageable some unpredictable ev risks battery disposal concerns regulated by cpcb dependence on brand technology and maintenance training stillevolving resale market food risks ingredient inflation wheat cheese poultry food licensing and health compliances fssai staff turnover and hygiene audits while food is mature and regulated ev risks are frontloaded once infrastructure is set timewasting ron giggled and backed off which was probably the most selfaware moment of the evening upon reconsideration council passed it act iii christmas save the generosity for the garbage staff usually get seven extra days off at christmas it is generous yes so neville abbott pops up with these 7 days are going to cost the taxpayer 56000 in staff time which is rich considering at least that much value in staff time has been consumed annually by his and his wifes garbage project would it be wrong for staff to vote on their own vacation days or is there something useless we could cut to nor is the cost of the overall replacement get er done at any cost thankfully the rest of council didnt feel like that act vi transparency hard pass finally a sobering moment thats no laughing matter abbott cunliffe and mclaughlin vote against adopting ombudspersonrecommended transparency measures around closed meetings measures many other municipalities are currently beginning to adopt we all know that closeddoor items often include things that should be in open but arent things that wouldnt happen if they were in open or things that mysteriously get buried where sunlight cant reach them a fair solution let staff compile a list of what should be public they have no political stake and dont live here silly we need this but well weve all seen council in action anyways abbott finds this suggestion hilarious the residents probably less so enjoy the smugness fellow taxpayers whats would be your choice for who should decide what goes from closed into open a the secrecy synchronized voting team or b neutral staff with no skin in the game the majority of council may have their ears firmly closed but your fellow residents dont and theyre far more likely to care than those three councillors

dad turns daughter in for hitting cyclist and driving away while on her phone good for the dad about two months after a tsa employee was killed in a hitandrun a woman has been arrested for the crime texas authorities say vivian padilla 19 has been charged with collision involving death el paso officials announced this week the fatal crash occurred in the early morning hours on sept 7 david oconnor 52 was riding on an electricassisted bicycle at about 130 am when a 2017 kia soul crashed into him from behind according to city officials the driver of the vehicle did not stop to check on the man following the impact instead electing to drive away oconnor was wearing a reflective vest and his bike had lights on it at the time of the crash according to an arrest affidavit obtained by local fox affiliate kfox traffic investigators arrived at the area the 4600 block of pershing street in el paso to find oconnor who had been thrown from his bicycle he succumbed to his injuries and was pronounced dead it was reportedly padillas father who turned her in to authorities twelve hours after the crash the father and daughter walked into the el paso police department headquarters with the older man telling officers shes the one that hit that person yesterday per kfox damage to padillas vehicle is said to have perfectly matched the broken car parts at the site of the crash and there were bloodstains inside and outside the vehicle the suspect is believed to have been on her phone during and after the crash padilla was placed in the el paso county downtown detention facility on a 50000 bond as of thursday she was no longer listed as being in the jail oconnor was a tsa employee at el paso international airport per his obituary he is remembered as having had a deep love for nature and adventure as well as caring for his beloved pet turtle he is survived by his parents siblings nieces and nephews

order before the ashes king for the day part three king for the day i never thought that i would spend so much of my retirement days arguing with ai i am also very disappointed with my chats with it i have found ai to be politically correct so i had to ask it how are you supposed to learn if you hesitate to give me a straight answer im thinking can no one or no thing just be honest and be free from social restraints and speak their truth my little ai friend has this attitude and leans a little too much for me it seems afraid to offend should truth have emotions thats a fascinating what if scenario thats a strong shift from how the us constitution currently works but its interesting to imagine what the effects might be excellent scenario thats a deep systemic reform idea thats a very important and sensitive question lets carefully unpack it the word youre asking about is one of the most loaded and painful words in the english language its origins are historical but its meaning has shifted over centuries thats a really insightful way to frame the question as king i can be provocative lend you some philosophical confessions and existential reflection as king i am allowed to speak absolute truths without apology freed from political correctness or institutional restraint my proclamations are in some cases extreme its a lament about a world where feelings eclipse facts and where discussion is policed by etiquette instead of reason ai becomes a metaphor for politeness over candor answers without moral courage and the repetition of empathy phrases that frustrate the king who searches for hard truth todays civilization is sanitized fearful and selfrestricting its a lament that even truth has been reprogrammed what a frightening thought it is absurd to expect human perfection from political systems most people feel both victimized by the wealthy and burdened by the irresponsibility of others in part one of my discussion i asked what are people talking about in report on the november 5th meeting of the stamford board of representatives hi its carl weinberg from district 20 on the stamford board of representatives the 31st bor held its final monthly meeting on november 5th and november 6th since the meeting ended after 1 am it was a jampacked agenda with many important decisions made some of them wise in my view and some of them not heres my report leaf blower ordinance by a vote of 23 yes 10 no and 3 abstentions the bor passed the leaf blower ordinance i sponsored this ordinance and voted yes here are its key provisions starting three years from now gasolinepowered handheld and backpack leaf blowers will be restricted to the months of october through december starting six years from now gasolinepowered walkbehind ridebehind and rideupon leaf blowers will be restricted to the months of october through december the city will transition from gasolinepowered landscaping equipment to electricpowered landscaping equipment over the next three years users of leaf blowers may ask for a oneyear extension of the threeyear or sixyear time period the city will initiate an educational program to advise on using electric leaf blowers safely including the proper ways to recharge batteries stamford joins over 100 municipalities nationwide including many in the northeast in restricting or banning gaspowered leaf blowers tree ordinance with one abstention the bor unanimously approved an ordinance to establish a comprehensive tree preservation and urban forestry program here are its key provisions creates an urban forester position who will be the citys lead authority on tree management and enforcement along with the tree warden creates a tree commission that will advise the urban forester and tree warden administer the tree fund and develop a master tree plan every five years creates a tree fund which will be dedicated to planting maintaining and preserving trees on public and private land and implementing the master tree plan requires payment of 1500 before removing a tree with a diameter of at least 13 inches with exceptions for removing hazardous dead or invasive trees establishes a legacy tree program and legacy tree registry to identify protect and promote trees of exceptional size age species cultural significance or ecological value imposes a fee of 4000 per diameterinch for removing a noninvasive legacy tree with exceptions for removing hazardous dead or invasive trees and with a waiver of the fee in exchange for planting replacement trees and establishes rules for planting and maintaining replacement trees some reps worried that the ordinance might impinge on the property rights of homeowners i thought about our trees at home they are our personal property but they are also a public good because they provide the public with so many benefits removing carbon dioxide from the air adding oxygen to the atmosphere reducing heat island effects preventing flooding returning organic material to the soil providing wintertime habitat for pollinators etc plus the pleasure we gain from trees beauty in my view this ordinance balances the propertyright interests of the property owner and the publicgood interests of the community veterans tax exemption as proposed by mayor simmons the bor unanimously approved an increase in the veterans tax exemption recent changes in state law allowed us to expand the existing tax exemption the ordinance exempts property and vehicle taxes for veterans with a servicerelated total disability and unemployability rating it also provides a 5000 exemption for all incomeeligible veterans in recognition of their service veterans have contributed so much to our security and veterans with servicerelated total disabilities have paid a significant price in my view this is a meaningful way to demonstrate our gratitude linkage fee increase the linkage fee is the percentage of commercial building permit fees that is transferred into the affordable housing trust fund the bor unanimously increased the percentage from 10 to 15 on the 32nd bor i will look for opportunities to increase the linkage fee even higher building permit fees are supposed to cover the costs of running the building department but the fees collected exceed the costs of the building department by a significant amount so funds are available for increasing the percentage disbursements from the affordable housing trust fund can help to reduce stamfords affordable housing crisis most recipients are notforprofit providers of affordable housing they apply these funds to the creation of new affordable housing units and the renovation of existing ones while leveraging these amounts with private funders the resulting developments help to lessen stamfords affordable housing crisis appointments commission ordinance by a vote of 26 yes and 12 no the bor passed an ordinance to increase the power of the appointments commission and allegedly increase transparency in the appointments process i voted no the original ordinance required the mayor to gain the approval of the appointments commission before nominating a candidate for a board or commission or provide a written explanation for not following the commissions advice following a legal opinion that such a requirement violated the charter the sponsors changed the word shall to may in several places in the ordinance this change passed legal muster but it also made the ordinance mostly toothless the revised ordinance retained one requirement of the mayor and thats why i voted no it requires the city to post a public list of every applicant for a volunteer board or commission even if they withdraw their application or the mayor decides not to nominate them each name will remain on that public list for four years nominations are a matter of public record because the bors appointments committee interviews those nominees in a public meeting with this ordinance the mere act of submitting an application will also become a matter of public record given my experience as a retired hr consultant i know how dangerous this public outing can be when a person applies for a new job a background check or even a simple google search will reveal that the person applied for a volunteer position with the city when the recruiter asks how did that work out the applicant will have to reply the mayor didnt nominate me in a hypercompetitive recruiting environment that can be all it takes for the applicant to lose out on the job plus who wants to risk the public embarrassment of the world knowing that they got turned down for a volunteer opportunity i proposed amending the ordinance to allow an applicant to opt out of placing their name on the public list of applicants the bor rejected the amendment by a vote of 12 yes and 27 no pet store ordinance by a vote of 35 yes 1 no and 1 abstention the bor approved an ordinance that bans the sale of dogs and cats in pet stores i wanted desperately to vote yes but i voted no because the citys legal department informed us that the ordinance violates state law i want to rid stamford of pet shops that sell dogs and cats by sourcing pets from breeding factories known as puppy mills their business model exploits animals for no reasonable human purpose this business model is deeply abhorrent to me but passing an ordinance that violates state law is also abhorrent and thats what this ordinance is a direct violation of ct state law it will have no force of law and will do nothing to ban these types of pet shops in stamford several nonattorney reps insisted that the ordinance does not violate state law ive seen this attitude of i dont like our lawyers guidance so ill disbelieve it before on the bor in my view its an abdication of our responsibilities as legislators instead of passing an unenforceable law what can we do the answer is plenty some of us picketed the existing puppymill stores in stamford as a result one of them closed down we convinced the zoning board to change the zoning regulations so new stores can only locate in industrial parts of the city since then no new puppymill stores have opened in stamford many of us support the citys new animal shelter by volunteering or by donating to stamford animal shelter alliance wwwstamfordanimalshelterallianceorg which will promote the adoption of pets instead of buying one from a puppymill store all of these activities require hard work and commitment and they dont generate the same public adulation as voting for in my view a feelgood unenforceable ordinance ill continue doing the things that i believe will get results annie summerville at the end of this legislative session representative annie summerville of district 6 will retire from the bor after 48 years of service she will retire as the longestserving representative in stamfords history annies life story inspires us all she was born in mississippi lived in alabama and left the segregated south by moving to stamford in the early 1960s she was first elected to the bor in 1977 her fellow representatives elected her repeatedly to bor leadership including service as board clerk responsible for managing the board office and fulfilling all of the bors compliance requirements she also served for many years as the chair of the bors appointments committee at our meeting the bor honored annie in two different ways first we named the board office as the annie m summerville board office at the government center second we renamed west park place as annie summerville way both are fitting tributes to a woman who has contributed so much to the people of stamford and who has mentored so many of her fellow representatives

tesla shareholders approve 1 trillion pay package for musk tesla inc shareholders approved a 1 trillion compensation package for chief executive officer elon musk the largest payout ever awarded to a corporate leader more than 75 of votes were cast in favor of the unprecedented pay plan the company said thursday at its annual meeting the outcome caps a weekslong campaign by the electric vehicle makers board its ceo and prominent retail investors to build support the pay agreement clears a path for musk the worlds richest person to become the first ever trillionaire and expand his stake in tesla to 25 or more over the next decade to achieve the full payout hell have to deliver on targets to significantly expand teslas market value revive its flagging car business and get the fledgling robotaxi and robotics efforts off the ground the compensation vote was pivotal for tesla after musk suggested he could step down or spend more time with his other companies if he didnt get greater control over the carmaker hes now likely to remain at the helm as tesla pursues an ambitious agenda built around driverless vehicles and artificial intelligence

uk paypermile tax explained what drivers need to know the uk government is set to introduce a new paypermile tax for electric vehicles aiming to plug the gap left by falling fuel duty revenues heres how it will work and what it means for drivers the game is changing for uk drivers especially those behind the wheel of electric vehicles evs as petrol and diesel revenues from fuel duty dry up the government plans to roll out a paypermile tax to balance the books and keep the roads funded starting around 2028 ev owners will be charged around 3p per mile traveled on top of their existing vehicle excise duty ved average ev drivers covering roughly 8900 miles a year could see bills approaching 250280 annually just for road usage hybrid owners wont escape either theyll pay a slightly lower rate reflecting their partial petrol use drivers will estimate their annual mileage pay upfront alongside their ved then settle any differences yearly go over your estimate expect a topup charge drive less get credit the scheme avoids intrusive gps monitoring while aiming for fairness why the shift petrol and diesel drivers currently shoulder about 600 a year in fuel duty evs which until recently paid no road tax now chip in but its still not enough as electric wheels take over the government faces a 40 billion shortfall by 2030 if it sticks to old revenue models critics argue this adds cost burdens to ev drivers just as the nation pushes green goals muddying the message with mixed signals encourage electric then tax harder yet proponents see a paypermile model as fair those who use the roads more should pay more no final design is set options include odometer checks during mots or tax renewals to verify mileage complexities loom rural drivers logging long miles might face sharp hikes while city drivers could benefit from lower costs for now this proposed system nicknamed ved is poised to reshape how britain funds its roads in a greener future the era of onesizefitsall flat road taxes is ending the message to drivers pay for the road you use not just the fuel you burn

tesla shareholders face the ultimate decision approve musks 1 trillion payday tesla shareholders have cast their ballots on elon musks eyepopping 1 trillion compensation plan a package promising the ceo an unprecedented payday if the company hits skyhigh growth targets over the next decade its the biggest boldest pay package ever proposed for a ceo teslas board pitched a plan that could hand elon musk close to 1 trillion in stock over the next ten years if and only if tesla hits some astronomical milestones shareholders had the final say on thursday voting on whether musk deserves this unprecedented haul the plan involves musk receiving over 423 million additional shares increasing his tesla stake to around 25 but its not a free ride to unlock the full fortune tesla must push its market value from approximately 15 trillion today to a jawdropping 85 trillion a leap that would make tesla bigger than the combined market caps of tech giants meta microsoft and alphabet beyond valuation musk must steer tesla to deliver 12 million additional vehicles annually deploy 1 million robotaxis and roll out 1 million humanoid robots among ambitious targets the stakes have never been higher success means musk could catapult from already one of the richest people on earth to the worlds first trillionaire not everyones sold major investors like norways sovereign wealth fund voted against the package citing worries over the sheer scale dilution risks and musks outsized influence proxy advisory firms have also urged shareholders to reject it tesla chairman robyn denholm and the board insisted musk is vital for teslas future they warned rejecting the plan could push musk to walk away risking teslas star leadership and its place at the cutting edge of ai robotics and electric vehicles the votes outcome will reshape teslas leadership story and set a new benchmark even in an era of astronomical executive paychecks musk betting teslas future on these gambits distinguishes him as both a visionary and a lightning rod waiting for the numbers to drop one things clear this is a vote with stakes bigger than just dollars teslas future and musks legacy hang in the balance

the most adventurous hikers agriculture moves to dedicated agroearths with perfect climates and mechanized farms could even be colocated with prime cities vastly simplifying food transportation space orbital access havent seen one in the novels yet but its likely there are earths lacking the earth where a portal opens out onto interplanetary space makes for stupidly easy access to solar orbit getting from there to anywhere else might be tricky for a freeflying vessel though you cant simultaneously go through a portal and bring it with you but if you can manage the transfer its super easy to go from a solar orbit back down to an earth orbit couple hundred ms deltav on an ion drive no pillars of flame needed inertial frames the thing about a spinning planet is that its rotation rate is not at all fixed a major earthquake might shift enough mass around to alter the length of the day by a microsecond or two which doesnt sound like much but at the equator that translates to a shift of about a millimeter per day ie unless two earths are absurdly closely aligned a rope strung through a portal would either grow slack or more taut with each passing day conceivably you could use this to generate power lasso a massive boulder that appears to be moving away from a portal and use it to turn a fixed generator that is geared wayyyyyy down first contact rivendell hasnt yet found out if the town they spotted merely made use of a swastika in their iconography or if they actually are nazis regardless they are in a very weak position and an actual industrial civilization that got ahold of gate tech would be able to steamroll them easily proliferation security risks weighed against all of this is the fact that gate tech is hideously dangerous if it proliferates theres no fixed safe places that you cant get to through a gate on another earth bank vaults data centers secure facilities theyre all just a step away through a portal that you cant block the only locations you cant easily gate into are ones that are constantly on the move spacecraft airplanes boats submarines etc case in point the coup attempt in earthside that routed through dino earth to get into the armory ive previously written about conducting a bombing raid with gateenabled planes fly over a deserted earth fly over where your target would be and open the gated bomb doors from their perspective it would look like bombs are just appearing in midair itd be mad cranked up to 11

tesla shareholders approve elon musks 1 trillion pay package tesla shareholders voted thursday to approve elon musks staggering new pay package in a move aimed at retaining the controversial ceos leadership during a time of great upheaval for the automaker over 75 percent of shares voted in favor of the proposal the vote gives musk enormous sway over his electric vehicle company as well as awards him with the largest corporate payout in history the final tally is expected to be disclosed in a securities and exchange commission filing in a few days the proposed pay package which was put forward by the board last september would award musk more than 423 million additional shares increasing his stake to about 25 percent from its current level of 15 percent in order to receive the full compensation musk would need to achieve a series of milestones including raising teslas market capitalization from its current 15 trillion to 85 trillion in 10 years musk must also put into service 1 million robotaxis and sell 12 million more cars 10 million full selfdriving subscriptions and 1 million humanoid robots

tesla shareholders approve 1 trillion pay package for musk bloomberg tesla inc shareholders approved a 1 trillion compensation package for chief executive officer elon musk the largest payout ever awarded to a corporate leader more than 75 of votes were cast in favor of the unprecedented pay plan the company said thursday at its annual meeting the outcome caps a weekslong campaign by the electric vehicle makers board its ceo and prominent retail investors to build support the pay agreement clears a path for musk the worlds richest person to become the first ever trillionaire and expand his stake in tesla to 25 or more over the next decade to achieve the full payout hell have to deliver on targets to significantly expand teslas market value revive its flagging car business and get the fledgling robotaxi and robotics efforts off the ground the compensation vote was seen as pivotal for tesla after musk suggested he could step down or spend more time with his other companies if he didnt get greater control over the carmaker hes now likely to remain at the helm as tesla pursues an ambitious agenda built around driverless vehicles and artificial intelligence tesla shares rose 25 as of 502 pm in postmarket trading thursday in new york the stock was up 14 this year through wednesdays close narrowly trailing the 16 advance in the sp 500 index the package was widely expected to pass even after several prominent investors came out in opposition including norways norges bank investment management teslas ninthlargest holder proxy advisers institutional shareholder services and glass lewis recommended investors reject the compensation plan citing concerns with its magnitude and its potential to dilute other shareholders ownership the board waged an aggressive effort to garner support featuring meetings with large institutional shareholders and a series of media appearances by chair robyn denholm in interviews with bloomberg news denholm cast the vote as crucial to teslas future which needs an engaged musk to achieve its goals musk himself sought to rally support using a portion of teslas recent earnings call to lay out why he wasnt comfortable building a robot army unless he owns a quarter of the company schwab asset management earlier this week pledged to back the pay proposal after a number of prominent retail shareholders said on social media that they would move funds out of brokerages that voted in opposition several other institutional investors including floridas state board of administration said they would vote for the package the win gives musk a clear albeit challenging path to becoming the worlds first trillionaire should he hit the all of the targets in the plan including expanding teslas market value to 85 trillion his total stake in the carmaker would be worth roughly 24 trillion thats more than quintuple his current net worth of about 460 billion according to the bloomberg billionaires index his net worth would exceed the current gross domestic product of all but seven countries musks fortune has been on a roller coaster ride this year it stood at roughly 450 billion in january when he joined president donald trump at his inauguration but began a rapid decline as the ceos politics including a prominent role at the department of government efficiency alienated many potential tesla buyers a subsequent feud between the two sent tesla shares plummeting leaving musk with the secondworst singleday loss ever recorded by the bloomberg billionaires index his wealth has since rebounded helped by a recovery in tesla shares as well as booming valuations for his privately held businesses including xai and spacex

firstyear formula student ev team from bangladesh looking for guidance advice hey everyone were a newly formed formula student ev team from bangladesh south asia im currently an undergrad cse student and our team is a mix of juniors and seniors from our university our members previously worked on autonomous robotics teams which are now internationally ranked in top 10 so we have experience with control systems ros embedded systems and electrical integration but building a full fs car is completely new for us this will be our first car so were trying to start things the right way instead of rushing into fabrication were mainly seeking advice on where to start planning the vehicle as a firstyear ev team how to choose motor inverter power range brands common combos how to size and configure the battery pack what suspension geometry and layout is realistic for a firstyear team drivetrain layout single motor diff vs dual motor direct drive what to prioritize first before touching cad or manufacturing if possible also share recommended motorinverter packages for beginners battery suggestions goto suppliers or manufacturers teams commonly use example electrical safety documentation templates good learning resources for vehicle dynamics also what are the common firstyear mistakes to avoid we want to prevent overcomplicating the design underestimating electrical safety oversized motor leading to overheating or inefficiency unrealistic aero package fabrication without complete validationtesting if you have lessons learned failure stories or suggestions wed really appreciate it any advice documents opensource models or mentorship would be super helpful thanks to this community in advance weve seen many helpful discussions here and hope to learn from you all

brawl stars seriously decided to see what all the hype is about brawl stars so i downloaded it and started playing admittedly havent played much just enough to see how much squad busters drew from that game having played boom beach and coc which are obviously nothing like squad busters and im seriously gobsmacked in total disbelief that bs is doing as well as it does so much better than squad busters ever did to me nearly everything in bs is inferior its got 1 of the actually visceral punch and visual pop of squad its like playing an old atari 2600 gamewhich i kind of get since i used to love atari to pieces back in the day but now i know squad busters is light years beyond brawl if id known brawl was the state of play in super cell landia before squad came along i would have been far more gentle and patient in my critiques of our beloved squad busters im so disappointed but maybe just maybe i get the decision to kill squad busters differently now squad is better but would take massive investments of time talent and outreach to get to where brawl is now meanwhile brawl is raking in the dough why even dream of ruffling the feathers of the golden goose super cell though a massively successful company is too small for these two games to easily coexist if squad came into its own that would spell trouble for the far inferior but more profitable brawl its analogous to trying to convert the fleet of automobiles in the us from internal combustion engine to electric motor vehicles evs are superior in most respects with far more promise as battery and recharging tech develops but monied interests keep us sipping away at the pump its all so damn sad
